sub_title: Full Professor, chair of EM4Care&Cure lab & Scientific Director Care&Cure Center C3Te@TU/e; MedTech entrepreneur and advisor; Associate Prof@Erasmus MC
summary:
My ambition is to develop novel value-based approaches for care and cure of patients. Hereto, I founded the research lab at TU/e on Electromagnetics for Care and Cure (www.tue.nl/EM4C&C) to develop novel electromagnetic approaches, like for improved neurostimulation, in/on body communication and magnetic resonance imaging (MRI). Our growing lab currently consists of 2 Assistant Professors, 1 part-time Associate Professor, 3 part-time Professors (UZGent, Catarina Hospital, Holst/IMEC), 1 PostDoc, 6 PhD’s, 5-10 BSc/MSc students and 4 associate PhD’s/PostDocs at partners. We specifically focus on (multi-physics) modelling, virtual device design, (experimental&clinical) validation and commercialization. Patient benefit is our goal, which we aim to achieve by strong collaboration with medical industry and partners like Ghent University & Donders/Radboud University (neurostimulation), Catharina Hospital (MR-radiotherapy) and Erasmus MC Cancer Institute (MR guided thermal therapy). In my earlier research, i worked on in novel hyperthermia applicators (leading to Sensius thermotherapy), computer aided treatment technology and pioneering data for improving RF exposure guidelines. 

Inaugural lecture as professor via:
https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLfCdPw4UmUXrh05MLFHDJGqm7AcaEtRoG

Since 2018, I am also Scientific Director of the Center for Care and Cure Technologies Eindhoven (www.tue.nl/C3Te). The C3Te is focussed on researching value driven medtech solutions in the care & cure domains, in strong collaboration with (local, national and international) medical and industrial partners. 

Specialties: Electromagnetic simulations
Radiofrequency
Radiotherapy
Multi-physics simulations
Hyperthermia
Thermal therapies
Magnetic resonance imaging hardware
MRI
MR-guided interventions
Clinical studies
Medical technology
Medtech

contributors.headline: Full Professor, chair of EM4Care&Cure lab & Scientific Director Care&Cure Center C3Te@TU/e; MedTech entrepreneur and advisor; Associate Prof@Erasmus MC

projects.title: Biomedical Imaging & Informatics - European Research and Training Initiative
projects.description:
WP3.2: MR Thermometry Applications of MR Image Guided Therapy

Thermal Therapy is a growing modality in cancer treatment. It is used as a minimal invasive technology to either directly kill tumorcells by heating them to high temperatures (>65°C) or to enhance the effectiveness of radiotherapy or chemotherapy by heating the tumor to 40-44°C for 60 minutes. High quality control is mandatory for an effective treatment and the introduction of non-
invasive temperature measurement by Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) provides a major step forward to gather 3D temperature information during thermal therapy. In this project, we will develop
the next level of thermal therapy: i.e. MR thermometry-based adaptive feedback control system for MR-guided RF hyperthermia. In this ambitious project, we aim at combining MR-thermometry with highly advanced electromagnetic treatment planning to obtain excellent control of the energy distribution and highly selective and conformal heating of the tumor. The success of this project will provide the technology for controlled application of targeted drug delivery by thermosensitive liposomes or for optimized radiotherapy sensitization.

This research project is a joint effort of TUM, the General Electric Company with its Global Research Centre located on the campus of the TUM and the Department of Radiation Oncology at Erasmus MC in Rotterdam.

contributors.headline: Full Professor, chair of EM4Care&Cure lab & Scientific Director Care&Cure Center C3Te@TU/e; MedTech entrepreneur and advisor; Associate Prof@Erasmus MC

projects.title: MR-guided Head and Neck Hyperthermia
projects.description: Design of a magnetic resonance (MR)-compatible HYPERcollar for non-invasive 3D temperature feedback during hyperthermia (thermal therapy). This project also includes the improvement and testing of novel accurate, motion-robust, MR thermometry techniques. Ultimately, the combination of the flexible heating capabilities of the HYPERcollar combined with 3D thermometry feedback allows target conformal heating, for maximum exploitation of radiation and drug sensitization leading to improved clinical outcome.

projects.title: Computer aided head and neck hyperthermia
projects.description: Implementation of adaptive computer-aided hyperthermia treatment using patient feedback and "scanning" of the heat focus. In addition, we improve treatment quality assurance and treatment "predictibility", e.g. by development of a novel applicator.

projects.title: Head and Neck hyperthermia
projects.description:
R&D of a clinical device for heating tumours in the head and neck.
Design of RF electronics & software, quality assurance and electrical safety assessments. Implementation of new clinical devices in the area of cancer treatment by training of medical
staff. Results: clinical device capable of heating tumours, using a phased-array of electromagnetic antennas, driven by high power RF electronics and controlled via a intuitive graphical user
interface by medical staff.

profile_positions.description: Research on application of EM waves in medical applications, like neuromodulation, MRI & MR guided therapies and in-body propagation/communication
profile_positions.title: Full Professor of (Bio)medical Electromagnetics
Chair of the Electromagnetics for Care&Cure Research Lab (EM4C&C)

profile_positions.description: The Center for Care and Cure Technologies Eindhoven (C3Te) aims at accelerating the development, validation and commercialisation of new medical technologies, in close collaboration with clinical and industrial partners in the Brainport region, the NL's and beyond.
profile_positions.title: Scientific Director of the Center for Care & Cure Technology Eindhoven (C3Te)

profile_positions.description: Research into advanced MRI and MRI guided therapy techniques
profile_positions.title: Associate Professor (Universitair hoofddocent)

profile_positions.description:
Research objectives: development of image-guided therapy for enhancing radiation treatment of cancer without side-effects. Inference of new bio-EM models for enhanced thermotherapy treatment planning and improved EM safety assessment (e.g. MRI, mobile phones,…)

Development, implementation and clinical evaluation of advanced (MRI guided) heating technology in clinical studies, inference and implementation of model-based approaches, independently as well as in cooperation with TU/e and other groups (e.g. BIGR, Radiology, Radiobiology of Erasmus MC), groups at NUI Galway, Uni. Reggio Calabria, TUDelft and the IT'IS Foundation/ETH Zurich (Switzerland) and industry (Sensius, GE Global Research, GE Healthcare, BSD Medical, Sennewald Medizintechniek, SPEAG/ZMT).
profile_positions.title: Universitair Hoofd Docent (Associate Professor): honorary since nov 2018

profile_positions.description:
Research objective: development of image-guided therapy for treatment of cancer without side-effects.

Activities:
- Groupleader head and neck hyperthermia research: clinical evaluation of heating technology in clinical studies and supervision of research into novel, image-guided, heating technology, independently as well as in cooperation with other groups (e.g. BIGR, Radiology, Radiobiology of Erasmus MC), groups at TUDelft, TU Eindhoven, UMC Utrecht and the IT'IS Foundation/ETH Zurich (Switzerland) and industry (Sensius, GE Global Research, GE Healthcare, BSD Medical, Sennewald Medizintechniek, SPEAG/ZMT). 
- Member of the Interventional Research Group: development and clinical implementation of (image-guided) novel interventions.
- Leader (dual) of the "Biology Image Guided Radiotherapy" research pillar of the Radiotherapy department: development and clinical evaluation of (MR) imaging tools and techniques for better tumour visualisation, tumour monitoring and improved sensitive tissue determination.
- Participation in research to establish the effects of EMF on tissue during daily life and medical applications
profile_positions.title: Universitair Docent (Assistant Professor)

profile_positions.description:
Research on radiofrequency thermal therapy (hyperthermia) equipment and techniques and their evaluation in the clinic / clinical studies.

During my PhD, I developed equipment for hyperthermia ("heat") treatment of tumors in the head and neck region. This treatment has great potential for enhancing current radio- and chemotherapy such that a successful and non/minimally-toxic treatment approach is in reach. Since then, my research focus has shifted to the development of simulation and MRI guided interventions and clinical assessment of (head and neck) hyperthermia.
profile_positions.title: Research Associate Hyperthermia Physics

profile_positions.description:
Development, construction and clinical introduction of a radiofrequency hyperthermia applicator for treatment of advanced tumors in the head and neck

During my PhD period, at Erasmus MC within KWF Kankerbestrijding project (DDHK2003-2855), I designed a clinical H&N HT applicator, coordinated the construction, supervised work on the power generation system and coordinated its clinical introduction. I closely cooperated with TNO (The Hague) in the development of a small and efficient radiator (2 papers, 3 abstracts) and with SPEAG (Zurich, Switzerland) in the development of patient-specific HTP (1 paper, 10 abstracts). Further, I have played a pivotal role in establishing a long term cooperation with SPEAG/ZMT and the IT'IS Foundation (ETH Zurich).
profile_positions.title: PhD student (cum laude)

profile_positions.description: Sensius BV is a startup company in medical technology dedicated to hyperthermia. The ambition of Sensius is to provide reliable equipment, knowledge and knowledge services to clinics worldwide for extending the application of cancer treatment with hyperthermia. During hyperthermia, parts of the body are heated to the range of 40-43degC to make radio- or chemotherapy more effective.
profile_positions.title: Co Founder, Advisor Medical Physics

profile_positions.description: Member of the Dutch Health Counsil and member of the permanent electromagnetic field (EMF) Committee that advises the Dutch Ministers on EMF matters
